body:
I keep seeing these server rejected event errors every now and then. My guess is it is trying to update an event that was expired in etcd. However I don't expect an error, since there is specific logic in `event.go` to handle that use case.

Any ideas why this may happening? I am using kubernetes 1.2.

Here is an example, from a host getting added to a cluster:

```
E0330 08:31:26.757466   24064 event.go:198] Server rejected event '&api.Event{TypeMeta:unversioned.TypeMeta{Kind:"", APIVersion:""}, ObjectMeta:api.ObjectMeta{Name:"elasticsearch-logging.144056583e429320", GenerateName:"", Namespace:"kube-system", SelfLink:"", UID:"", ResourceVersion:"1634368", Generation:0, CreationTimestamp:unversioned.Time{Time:time.Time{sec:0, nsec:0, loc:(*time.Location)(nil)}}, DeletionTimestamp:(*unversioned.Time)(nil), DeletionGracePeriodSeconds:(*int64)(nil), Labels:map[string]string(nil), Annotations:map[string]string(nil)}, InvolvedObject:api.ObjectReference{Kind:"Service", Namespace:"kube-system", Name:"elasticsearch-logging", UID:"687749f9-dc9f-11e5-9867-06ef3ecbd7cb", APIVersion:"v1", ResourceVersion:"1633611", FieldPath:""}, Reason:"UpdatedLoadBalancer", Message:"Updated load balancer with new hosts", Source:api.EventSource{Component:"service-controller", Host:""}, FirstTimestamp:unversioned.Time{Time:time.Time{sec:63594858016, nsec:0, loc:(*time.Location)(0x26f9e80)}}, LastTimestamp:unversioned.Time{Time:time.Time{sec:63594923486, nsec:756157274, loc:(*time.Location)(0x26f9e80)}}, Count:6, Type:"Normal"}': 'events "elasticsearch-logging.144056583e429320" not found' (will not retry!)
Mar 30 08:31:26 ip-10-50-185-118 start-kube-controller-manager.sh[24064]: I0330 08:31:26.756181   24064 servicecontroller.go:685] Successfully updated 12 out of 12 load balancers to direct traffic to the updated set of nodes
```

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG API Machinery.
labels.name: sig/api-machinery

title: Occasional server rejected event errors
